{"step_by_step_thinking": "IFNg, or Interferon gamma, is a type of cytokine that is critical for innate and adaptive immunity against viral and intracellular bacterial infections and for tumor control. Indoleamine 2,3-dioxygenase (IDO) is an enzyme that catalyzes the initial step in tryptophan catabolism to kynurenine. IFNg has been shown to induce the expression of IDO in various cell types, including macrophages and dendritic cells, as a part of the immune response.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
